They took away a lot of fun stuff, monetized what they left behind way more than most games. Overwatch 1 Veteran.
The game we have now is a shell of its former self.
Built to drain your money, your time, and your energy.
We used to get almost daily lootboxes with different items in them, wasn't weird to get a legendary about once every week or so if you played actively. Duplicates gave currency to buy ones you wanted specifically, and no skin was sold (except for those charity ones which is fair).
Then came the promise of PvE! BUT ALAS! it required some upgrade to the base game because it just wasn't possible as the game was then. So we got Overwatch 2, a glorified sequel which was just a patch.
No more weekly lootboxes. Now you have to pay upwards of 20â‚¬ to get ONE skin. of which they release several each month.
Back then heroes were free. Now you gotta grind to level something or other in the season pass, or pay to unlock them if you missed the season.
Season passes are barely worth the price unless you plan to do matches DAILY. and if you didn't set enough time off to do os, tough shit. you paid for something you will now never get.
We dealt with it though. because PvE was coming, they kept talking about it, promising, just half a year.
Then the truth was revealed. No PvE, they had probably cancelled it years ago and only used it as a hype scapegoat.
Instead we are gonna get these cheap knockoff story missions every season that you have to pay for?!
I am out, I should have left when Overwatch became Overwatch 2, but I stuck by it for one and a half seasons.
Seasons which just grew more and more dull.
log in, look at objectives, "ok I gotta play X and do Y Z amount of times.." 

No more considering "what do I feel like playing today? No. now its "We will tell you what to play, if you want to get those rewards you paid for."

The game is absolutely fun, and has been a blast to play with for years now.

I do recommend playing this game in general, as it is probably the most well polished Hero Shooter available, and is tons of fun with friends and whatnot.

While I do recommend playing this game with friends and having a blast, I don't recommend supporting Blizzard as a company. Enjoy the game, but know that the company themselves are scummy, and money-grabbing.
